result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Pennington

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

10:33 AM Defendant Christopher L Pennington in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

Defendant did not qualify for PD representation and appears unrepresented today. Court advises of right to an attorney, including petition for appointment of court appointed counsel. 

Defendant states he wants to proceed pro-se, and requests a plea/sentencing hearing. 

State requests a hearing farther out to get a restitution figure. 

Court sets plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets. 

State conveys PTO to the Defendant in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 09/12/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

2:35 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Christopher L Pennington in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Christopher L Pennington. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
